instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
Reflow the smc ,flash new bios smc2925 clean,still no image
all rail present
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL>-pwgrd 3.3v
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> 1.8v
only i notice that is <SIGNAL>SPI_CLK</SIGNAL> is low 0v (maybe thats normal)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SPI_CLK</SIGNAL> will only momentarily operate and you can only really see it with a scope. 
All your rails are good?
You have checked for a waterdamged resistor pad?  Something like that hiding somewhere?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message: I didnt found any rail missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
Any history available?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high?

Which new BIOS did you try?
Some links are posted on the forum.

Did you test USB activity?

threads.message: Is it normal that my <SIGNAL>SMC_THRMTRIP</SIGNAL> is 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
"Which new BIOS did you try?
Some links are posted on the forum."
???
Let us know what you've really tested...

Use USB pendrive/HDD with Link LED and preinstalled OSX to confirm, or not, USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message: I use 2 different bios from donor board ,try usb and get lights for about 30 sec then off ,if you unplug and recconect lights is on again for around 30 sec

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
USB mouse can trick you sometime.
Always best to test USB activity in the other manner.

Did you pick BIOS chips for test from working boards?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message: There were dead board cant confirm working bios,and when is on its drawing 650mA on power supply ,I remember the working one was around 350mA ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> is there but no chime no image
threads.message:
Hard to think you've got bad BIOS chips from different boards.
But cannot discard BIOS issue, untill try known good working file.

Check all voltages from pages 57/58 and also voltage on all (big) L/C blocks near PCH/CPU area.

History fault can give a clue, but not reply from you.
Also no USB activity confirmed 100%.
